actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide a reduction of individual income tax rates for 1981, 1982, and 1983.
short_title: Individual Income Tax Rate Reduction Act of 1980

summary.text: Individual Income Tax Rate Reduction Act of 1980 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to reduce individual income tax rates for taxable years beginning after 1982. Sets the highest marginal income tax rate at 50 percent of taxable income. Phases in such tax reductions for 1981 and 1982. Increases the zero bracket amount (formerly the standard deduction) for each category of taxpayer. Increases the income levels at which a tax return is required to be filed. Reduces the rate of the alternative minimum tax.

titles.title: Individual Income Tax Rate Reduction Act of 1980
A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide a reduction of individual income tax rates for 1981, 1982, and 1983.
